alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 1:09PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kenedy, northeastern Hidalgo, northwestern Cameron and Willacy Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 108 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cluster of thunderstorms over northwest Cameron, southern Willacy, and eastern Hidalgo Counties, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Harlingen, San Benito, Raymondville, La Feria, Elsa, Edcouch, Santa Rosa, Lyford, Rio Hondo and La Villa. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 21 and 51. US Highway 77 between mile markers 742 and 762. US Highway 281 between mile markers 746 and 760. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo
